key_title: Key to the species of Corunastylis

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the families in the Asparagales-Liliales complex
Key to the genera of Orchidaceae

leads.lead_text: Flowers lacking cilia on any segment, labellum margins and column wings sometimes irregular or denticulate but never ciliate
Flowers ciliate on at least one floral segment
Free part of leaf lamina ending short of lowest flower, usually appressed to flowering stem
Free part of leaf lamina arising among the lower flowers and projecting conspicuously outwards
Labellum lanceolate, apex acuminate to long-acuminate
Labellum oblong, obovate or cuneate, apex obtuse to acute
Petals lacking an apical gland; labellum obovate-oblong or cuneate, contracting abruptly to an upturned irregularly crenate tip; flowers well-spaced
Petals gland-tipped; labellum more or less obovate, tip rounded or obtuse, margins entire or crenulate; flowers congested
Dorsal sepal 3.5–4 mm long; lateral sepals 4.5–5 mm long; mainly north of the Dividing Range
Dorsal sepal 3–3.5 mm long; lateral sepals 4–4.5 mm long; apparently confined to near-coastal areas between Sale and Bairnsdale
Gland on petals bead-like; labellum dark purplish black; dry inland areas
Gland on petals thin and wavy; labellum green to yellowish; moist coastal and near-coastal habitats
Lateral sepals about twice as long as the narrow-lanceolate labellum; very rare in the Otway Ranges
Lateral sepals considerably less than twice as long as the obovate labellum; very rare in the Snowy Plains area
Cilia confined to labellum margins
Cilia present on labellum and at least some other perianth segments
Flowers 2–3 mm across; perianth segments gland-tipped; labellum cilia 0.1–0.2 mm long
Flowers 4–6 mm across; perianth segments not gland-tipped; labellum cilia more than 0.5 mm long
Lateral sepals erect or sub-erect; perianth segments wholly purple to purplish black; montane to sub-alpine areas; flowers appearing in Summer
Lateral sepals porrect or deflexed; perianth segments not wholly purplish black; lowland areas; flowers appearing in Autumn
Lateral sepals porrect; perianth segments usually bright green with a contrasting reddish labellum
Lateral sepals deflexed; perianth segments dark green and purplish with a dark reddish labellum
Cilia sparse, short, present on labellum and petals but not dorsal sepal; flowers mostly 5–12 in a short crowded inflorescence
Cilia numerous, long, present on labellum, petals and dorsal sepal; flowers mostly 10–22 in a long crowded inflorescence
